product package

Subpackages

Submodules

product.admin module

class product.admin.ProductAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

This class is used to allow the admin to edit certain aspects of the product information such as the title, the price, and the quantity of a product.

Variables:

list_display – A tuple specifying the fields to display in the admin list view. By default, it includes ‘title’, ‘price’, and ‘quantity’.

product.apps module

class product.apps.ProductConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

This class allows certain configurations for the primary app in the Django project, the product app.

Variables:

  • default_auto_field – The default database field for AutoField, set to ‘django.db.models.BigAutoField’.

  • name – The name of the app, which is ‘product’.

product.models module

class product.models.Product(*args, **kwargs)[source]

This product model is the model used for the app, it defines the content rules of the app.

Rules:

Certain rules that the product model applies is the max length of the title of a product being 200 characters.

The price of the product having a max digit of 10 with 2 decimal paces/

Only being able to show positive integers for the quantity of a product

This class represents a product in the e-commerce application.

Variables:

  • title – The title or name of the product, limited to a maximum of 200 characters.

  • description – A detailed description of the product.

  • price – The price of the product, with a maximum of 10 digits and 2 decimal places.

  • quantity – The quantity of the product in stock, represented as a positive integer.

exception DoesNotExist
exception MultipleObjectsReturned

product.urls.app_name

Important URLs listed to easily connect the Django project when navigating the webpage.

product.views module

class product.views.ProductDetailView(**kwargs)[source]

Displays a more detailed view of the product in a seperate webpage

Displays a more detailed view of the product in a separate webpage.

Variables:

  • context_object_name – The name used to reference the product object in the template.

  • model – An alias of Product.

  • template_name – The name of the HTML template used for rendering the detailed view.

model

alias of Product

product.views.online_shop(request)[source]

Fetches a list of products from a database and generates it on the online shop webpage.

Fetches a list of products from a database and generates it on the online shop webpage.
